text:
Don't know if anyone are using Microsoft 365 as there Mailbox Server and forward emails to HubSpot.
But we found out this issue with Microsoft 365 and it seems like they are role out this new function as we speak.
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Outlook-Sales-Extension/Forwarding-emails-rejected-by-server/m-p/382266>
So I posted my comments and how to solve it in the community.
Thank you. Does this happen when using the Outlook Sales Add-In?
How do you use contact tokens/properties in a chatflow message when it's a message and not a bot?

Does moving a file (like an image) update its URL where it was linked before moving it? For example, if my client has a bunch of blog images in their root folder and creates a new folder "Blog Images", then moves them, does all of the instances of that image throughout the website now update to show the correct/new URL? When you move files in the file manager, it updates its URL to show the new folder name.

This is only when you have create a Forward Address in Office 365 that push all emails direct to HubSpot. Example if you push <mailto:sales@company.com|sales@company.com> for example or <mailto:support@company.com|support@company.com> to your HubSpot Service Hub.
